TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , was born in DATE . She is a national of GPE and GPE . The applicant lives in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

Since DATE the applicant had been living with her uncle PERSON in a oneroom flat in GPE . PERSON , who owned the flat , died on DATE . By a court ’s decision given in DATE Miss PERSON , who was a minor at that time , inherited the flat . The applicant travelled often to GPE but was allowed to live in the flat each time she returned to GPE , since this was in accordance with the last will of ORG , and ORG parents were in agreement with the arrangement .

In DATE ORG title to the flat was challenged before ORG which decided to reopen the inheritance proceedings . In DATE M.M. applied to ORG for an eviction order in respect of the applicant . However , the proceedings concerning her application were stayed pending the outcome of the inheritance proceedings .

In DATE PERSON requested the applicant to leave the flat by DATE . During the applicant ’s absence from GPE PERSON had changed the locks in the flat . Upon the applicant ’s return , on DATE she removed the locks with the assistance of private security agents and entered the flat . On DATE PERSON informed the police that the applicant had been living in the flat without being registered .

On DATE at TIME the applicant heard somebody banging on the door and shouting “ Open , police ” . The applicant opened the door . CARDINAL police officers entered the flat and inspected the applicant ’s identity card , in particular the part concerning the applicant ’s registered address ( zameldowanie ) . The police officers informed the applicant that she should leave the flat and that FAC should be allowed to take possession of it as she had title to it .

At this point several young men who accompanied PERSON started to remove the applicant ’s personal effects from the flat . They carried the applicant , dressed only in her underwear , out of the flat in an armchair . They also humiliated and insulted her . The police officers , who remained inside the flat , did not react to the behaviour of the young men and stated that the applicant had to leave the flat and that their duty was to protect her . In view of the violence used against her , the applicant decided to leave the flat taking only her documents with her . Subsequently , on DATE , PERSON changed the locks .

On DATE at TIME the applicant , accompanied by private security agents , removed the locks fitted by FAC and entered the flat . The applicant verified the contents of the flat and discovered that ORG CARDINAL and a ORG watch were missing . Shortly afterwards , PERSON , together with several individuals , came to the flat . She was followed by police officers . The police officers announced that the applicant had committed a burglary and started to take photographs of the flat . CARDINAL of the individuals accompanying FAC , a certain PERSON , insulted the applicant and pulled a telephone receiver from her hand . The police officers did not react . Moreover , the police officers did not allow the applicant ’s brother to speak to her . CARDINAL p.m. and TIME the entrance to the flat was blocked by QUANTITY police officers .
On DATE PERSON removed the front door of the flat .
On DATE CARDINAL police officers came to the flat and advised the applicant that she was not allowed to install a new front door .

On DATE the applicant was in the flat together with private security agents hired by her . At TIME M.M. came to the flat accompanied by several individuals and QUANTITY police officers . CARDINAL of the police officers was the Warsaw Ochota Deputy Police Commissioner . Initially , the security agents hired by the applicant refused them entry . However the police officers threatened that they would call for reinforcements and the agents let them in . The police officers allowed ORG to move into the flat . PERSON remained in the flat where she lived together with the applicant until DATE .

On DATE the applicant and her belongings were removed from the flat by M.M. assisted by several individuals . The applicant immediately called the police , but the police officers who arrived at the scene did not intervene .

On DATE police officers knocked on the applicant ’s door and she let them in . After having inspected her identity document the police officers informed the applicant that she had been living in the flat without being registered there , which constituted a petty offence , and summoned her to appear at the police station the following day . While the police officers were leaving , PERSON , accompanied by persons who had stayed outside in the corridor , entered the flat . Both the applicant and PERSON requested the police officers to stay as they felt insecure . A police officer spoke on the telephone to the officer on duty who instructed them to remain at the scene . They remained in the corridor until TIME . The applicant signed an agreement with PERSON to the effect that on DATE she would move out and take all her belongings with her . Subsequently , the locks were changed and the keys were deposited with the representative of the housing cooperative .

On DATE the applicant accompanied by private security agents and a locksmith removed the locks and entered the flat . The police were informed by neighbours that there had been a burglary in the flat . Police officers came to the flat and inspected the identity documents of the persons present . They stayed in the corridor as in the meantime PERSON had arrived . Subsequently , the applicant ’s brother tried to enter the flat by force and threatened FAC with an electroshock gun ( paralizator ) . The police intervened in order to stop him and inspected his identity documents .

The applicant stated to the Police Commissioner that she wished to make a formal declaration that ORG had committed a crime . PERSON had also requested the police to investigate the charges of burglary against the applicant , but the proceedings were discontinued on DATE .
The police were called by ORG . On both occasions they inspected the identity documents of the persons present in the corridor , but did not enter the flat .

On DATE the police were called by the applicant ’s sisterinlaw who wanted to enter the flat which had been locked by M.M. and the applicant . Since FAC did not let her in , the applicant stepped out of the flat and spoke to her sisterinlaw . Police officers were present , but did not intervene .
The applicant and PERSON lived together in the flat until DATE . On that date the applicant removed her belongings and left .

On DATE the applicant ’s counsel filed a request with ORG to prosecute the police officers who on DATE had intervened in the dispute over the applicant ’s flat . The counsel informed the prosecution service that the police officers had used force to enter the applicant ’s flat and had proceeded to evict the applicant . The counsel further pointed out that he represented the applicant in several civil cases and was certain that the eviction proceedings against the applicant had been stayed pending the outcome of the inheritance proceedings . The counsel concluded that the police officers had not had an eviction order and their actions had therefore been unlawful .

On DATE the ORG discontinued the investigation into the applicant ’s allegations . The prosecutor heard the applicant , PERSON and the police officers . He concluded that the police officers who were sent to intervene on DATE were ordered to inspect the registration address and that they had then stayed at the request of both women who had been quarrelling . The prosecutor found that the events as alleged by the applicant did not take place . Consequently , he concluded that the actions taken by the police officers were legal and were aimed at preventing a breach of the law by the persons present .
The applicant ’s counsel appealed and it appears that the case was again examined by ORG .
On DATE ORG again decided to discontinue the investigation into the charges brought against the police officers by the applicant . The prosecutor ’s decision included the following conclusion :

“ The evidence collected in the case shows that the police officers intervening DATE and DATE did not violate any of PERSON McKayKopecka ’s rights . The police officers were only ordered to carry out an inspection of her registered address ( kontrola meldunkowa ) .

It should also be pointed out that it is difficult to agree with the victim ’s claims that the police officers by their failure to act approved the removal of her personal effects and by their presence forced her to accept the new situation . The evidence taken from witnesses shows that the police officers on numerous occasions remained at the scene at the request of the victim or M.M. Moreover , the evidence does not confirm the victim ’s allegations that her personal effects were taken away .
In view of the above I conclude that the actions of the police officers complied with legal regulations and were aimed at avoiding breaches of the law by the individuals present at the scene . ”
The applicant appealed against this decision , but her appeal was dismissed on DATE by ORG . ORG decision concluded as follows :

“ As was rightly pointed out by ORG no evidence has been collected which would confirm an abuse of power or a failure by the intervening police officers to fulfil their duty . The interventions concerned verification of the registered address and resulted from a request of the president of the housing cooperative who had misled the police with respect to the title to the flat .

The applicant unsuccessfully attempted to prosecute ORG on charges of inter alia theft and unlawful eviction . On DATE ORG discontinued the investigation and found that no offence had been committed .
On DATE ORG discontinued the investigation against the applicant , instituted upon ORG request , into charges relating to inter alia the breaking down of the door of the flat .

The applicant instituted civil proceedings against ORG in which she sought restitution of the actual possession of the flat . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s application . She appealed against this decision , but her appeal was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
Article CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( PERSON ) provides that the failure to register one ’s address is punishable by limitation of liberty ( ograniczenie wolnosci ) , a fine or a reprimand .
Articles CARDINAL et seq . of ORG ( ORG cywilny ) provide for the ORG ’s liability in tort .
“ CARDINAL . The State Treasury shall be liable for damage caused by a ORG official in the performance of the duties entrusted to him . ”
